result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Hazard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian K Hazard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian K Hazard was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, by 11/30/15 or civil judgment.
*Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Concurrent with: With any other sentence, with 4 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K Hazard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian K Hazard in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Brian K Hazard in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with 4 days credit.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, by 11-30-2015 or civil judgment.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Brian K Hazard not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The State's file is not in court.  The defendant was not produced from MSDF.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese Dick appeared and advised the clerk that the defendant is in custody at MSDF.  Defense requested a plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled on September 10, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 24.

Defendant Brian K Hazard in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brian K Hazard in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Brian K Hazard in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
